page.title: 14Employment-Winmarleigh(1)
page.content: One needs but to drive through the village to see that the predominant activity of the land,not the people, is agriculture. Our survey of{1000 acres}showed that only{19 men}were emplyed on them.The variety of patterns revealed that on {average}a farm unit is{166 acres}and employs{3 men,}including the owner or tenant farmer. They utilised their land- 84 acres permanent grass,53 acres temporary grass,21 acres barley,5 acres other cereals,2 acres potatoes,with,100 head dairy cows,56 beef cattle,27 sheep and 92 pigs. These figures 'hide' the activity on individual farms but do provide a fair picture of the general land cover/use. The farms surveyed were from{55 acres with{2 men}to{183 acres}of intensive {dary and beef}employing just 3 men.
